project.name: Top Level Project for AR / Workbenchs
project.description:
Workbench and AR requires the astrogrid/maven-base projects to be checked out adjacent to this folder. (NB: previous versions also required the aggregate project - this is no longer necessary) --- BOOTSTRAPPING On a fresh download, you need to run a few goals to get things started - otherwise event things like 'maven astrogrid-clean' will fail. -1. run % maven create-keystore 0. run % maven install-materials
You may wish to increase the memory maven runs with. create a '~/.mavenrc' which contains the line MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx1024m"
This build requires Java 1.4 - it will fail under 1.5. You might need to do a export JAVA_VERSION=1.4.2 to cause the correct version of java to be run --- PUBLISHING Publisher should just run the goals listed in this project - no need to run goals in individual sub-projects. E.g. to build and publish new suite of AR: 1. % maven astrogrid-clean 2. Edit astrogrid.destop.version in ${basedir}/template/project.properties 3. % maven astrogrid-build-artifact
Build products are then left in ${basedir}/target/artifacts directory, from where they (for now) have to be uploaded to the plone site by hand. --- ECLIPSE To setup workbench for development in eclipse: run steps 1-2 above. 3. % maven install-materials 4. % cd impl; maven eclipse 5. In Eclipse select 'File > Import > Existing Projects into Workspace', and navigate to the impl directory. This works best in Eclipse >= 3.2 and above. --- If you need to edit the public api, repeast steps 5,6 for the 'api' directory --- For for development instruction, run % cd impl; maven -u
